text: Vata-Balancing Foods (Ayurveda) • Vata increases with cold, dry, light, irregular habits. Balance it with warm, moist, grounding, oily, and stable foods. Core Principles • Prefer warm > cold, cooked > raw, moist > dry, oily > fat-free. • Choose sweet, sour, salty tastes; minimize bitter, pungent, astringent. • Eat at regular times; avoid skipping meals. Best Foods for Vata Grains (soft, warm, easy to digest) • Rice (white or red) • Wheat (chapati, paratha with ghee) • Oats (porridge) • Quinoa (well-cooked) • Semolina (upma) • Why: Provides grounding and steady energy. Lentils & Legumes • Moong dal (yellow moong is ideal) • Masoor dal (well-cooked) • Urad dal (in moderation) • Avoid: dry chana, rajma, raw sprouts • Why: Light proteins but should be cooked with ghee, ginger. Vegetables (warm, cooked, oily) • Sweet potato • Pumpkin • Carrot • Beetroot • Squash • Green beans • Bottle gourd • Ridge gourd • Spinach (cooked) Avoid or minimize (too drying): • Cabbage, cauliflower, broccoli, raw salad, mushrooms. 1

Fruits (ripe, sweet, non-astringent) • Bananas • Mango • Papaya • Avocado • Berries (stewed) • Grapes • Apples (best stewed with cinnamon) • Avoid: raw apples, unripe pears, dry fruits without soaking. Nuts & Seeds • Almonds (soaked/peeled) • Walnuts • Cashews • Sesame seeds • Pumpkin seeds (small amounts) • Avoid: peanuts (dry, sharp). Oils & Fats (very important for Vata) • Ghee • Sesame oil • Olive oil • Coconut oil (warm climates) Dairy • Warm milk (with pinch of turmeric or nutmeg) • Ghee • Paneer (fresh, lightly cooked) • Yogurt (only in moderation and not cold) Spices (stimulate digestion gently) • Ginger • Cumin • Cinnamon • Cardamom • Asafoetida (hing) • Turmeric • Ajwain • Avoid: excess chilli, mustard seeds. Breakfast Options (Vata-Friendly) • Warm oats porridge with ghee, cinnamon, banana. 2

• Upma with vegetables and ghee. • Moong dal cheela with paneer. • Stewed apples with nuts. • Vegetable poha (moist, warm). Snacks • Roasted sweet potato • Warm soup (moong, vegetable) • Steamed idli with ghee • Fruit stews • Almond-date energy balls Foods to Avoid (Increase Vata) • Cold foods/drinks • Dry snacks (kurkure, chips, popcorn) • Raw salads • Gas-causing foods (cauliflower, rajma, chana) • Excess caffeine • Overnight oats, cold smoothies • Intermittent fasting (irregular meals worsen Vata) Simple Vata-Balancing Meal Ideas • Rice + moong dal khichdi + ghee • Vegetable soup + chapati • Sweet potato mash with ghee • Khichdi with carrots + beetroot + cumin • Haldi doodh + soaked almonds for evening 3
